message.body: Hey-would you give me a call at lunch? I really need to treat Ruby, and there are two different treatment options (one is a 3-day for $90 and the other is a 7-day for $36), but they say to always treat both dogs in the household and they can't issue meds to Simone because she isn't a patient there. We need to act fast.
Diarrhea could soon ensue, and the cysts are quite contagious.
Ok. Whats the name of the med?
Drontil is the 3-day $90 option, and Panacur is the weeklong liquid option for $36
I left a message with Susan, hopefully i can get the prescription tomorrow when theyre open
Yes, but Panacur takes longer so if I treat with Drontal and it takes 3days, and you treat with Panacur and ruby comes into contact with a cyst from Simone, she could get it again.
We should both be on the same page
Plus we need to bath them throughout treatment.
I think that the soonest i can get the meds is tomorrow so we should start them at the same time no?
Yeah I guess so. I just hate thinking about waiting. They say Ruby has a heavy load. :(
I redeemed all the bottles, it was a whopping $12.50
